result.content:
# ACME Engineering Best Practices

This document outlines the engineering standards and best practices for all ACME development teams.

## Code Quality

### Code Reviews

All code must be reviewed by at least one other team member before merging.

#### Review Checklist

- [ ] Code follows style guidelines
- [ ] Tests are included and passing
- [ ] Documentation is updated
- [ ] Performance considerations addressed

### Testing

Comprehensive testing is required for all production code.

#### Unit Tests

Write unit tests for all business logic and core functionality.

#### Integration Tests

Verify that components work together correctly.

#### End-to-End Tests

Test critical user flows to ensure system integrity.

## Documentation

Good documentation is essential for maintainable code.

### Code Comments

Write clear, concise comments explaining the "why" not just the "what".

### API Documentation

Document all public APIs with examples and usage guidelines.

### Architecture Decisions

Record important architectural decisions in our ADR (Architecture Decision Records) repository.

## Security Practices

Security is everyone's responsibility.

### Authentication and Authorization

Implement proper authentication and authorization for all user-facing features.

### Input Validation

Always validate and sanitize user input to prevent injection attacks.

### Secrets Management

Never commit secrets to version control. Use environment variables or secret management tools.

### Dependency Management

Keep dependencies up to date and scan for known vulnerabilities.

## Deployment

Follow these guidelines for safe deployments.

### Deployment Process

1. Create a feature branch
2. Implement changes with tests
3. Submit pull request
4. Get approval from team
5. Deploy to staging
6. Run smoke tests
7. Deploy to production
8. Monitor for issues

### Rollback Procedures

Have a clear rollback plan for each deployment.

## Performance

Consider performance in all design decisions.

### Caching

Use caching strategically to improve response times.

### Database Optimization

Write efficient queries and use appropriate indexes.

### Monitoring

Set up monitoring and alerting for critical metrics.

result.content:
# ACME Cloud Infrastructure

Reliable, scalable, and secure cloud infrastructure to power your applications.

## What is ACME Cloud?

ACME Cloud provides enterprise-grade cloud computing services with unmatched reliability and performance.

## Services Offered

### Compute Resources

Deploy virtual machines with flexible configurations to meet your workload demands.

### Storage Solutions

Choose from object storage, block storage, or file storage based on your needs.

### Networking

High-speed, low-latency networking with global reach and redundant paths.

### Security Features

ACME Cloud provides comprehensive security features to protect your infrastructure:

#### Encryption

All data is encrypted at rest using AES-256 and in transit using TLS 1.3.

#### Network Security

Built-in firewall protection and DDoS mitigation at the network edge.

#### Compliance Certifications

ACME Cloud maintains SOC 2, ISO 27001, and HIPAA compliance certifications.

## Architecture

Our infrastructure is built for scale and reliability.

#### Availability Zones

Deploy across multiple availability zones for maximum uptime.

#### Load Balancing

Automatic traffic distribution across your resources.

#### Auto-Scaling

Automatically adjust resources based on demand.

## Use Cases

### Web Applications

Host scalable web applications with ease.

### Big Data Processing

Run large-scale data processing jobs with powerful compute instances.

### Disaster Recovery

Implement comprehensive backup and recovery solutions.

## Getting Started

### Create an Account

Sign up for an ACME Cloud account to get started.

### Set Up Your First Instance

Follow our step-by-step guide to launch your first virtual machine.

### Configure Security Settings

Set up firewalls, security groups, and access controls for your cloud resources.

#### Security Groups

Configure inbound and outbound traffic rules for your instances.

#### IAM Policies

Manage user access and permissions through Identity and Access Management.

### Monitor Your Resources

Use our monitoring tools to track performance and costs.

result.content:
# ACME Analytics Platform

ACME Analytics is our flagship product, providing powerful data analytics and business intelligence capabilities.

## Overview

Transform your raw data into actionable insights with ACME Analytics.

## Key Features

### Real-Time Dashboards

Monitor your business metrics in real-time with customizable dashboards.

### Advanced Reporting

Generate comprehensive reports with automated scheduling and distribution.

### Data Integration

Connect to multiple data sources including databases, APIs, and cloud services.

### Predictive Analytics

Use machine learning algorithms to forecast trends and identify opportunities.

## Getting Started

### Installation

Follow these steps to set up ACME Analytics in your environment.

#### System Requirements

- Minimum 8GB RAM
- 50GB available storage
- Modern web browser

#### Setup Process

1. Download the installation package
2. Run the installer
3. Configure your data connections
4. Set up your first dashboard

## Pricing

Choose the plan that best fits your needs.

### Starter Plan

Perfect for small businesses
- Up to 5 users
- Basic dashboards
- Email support

### Professional Plan

For growing teams
- Up to 50 users
- Advanced analytics
- Priority support

### Enterprise Plan

For large organizations
- Unlimited users
- Custom integrations
- Dedicated account manager

result.content:
# ACME Security Guidelines

## Overview

This document outlines ACME's approach to security across our organization and products.

## Information Security Policy

### Data Classification

All ACME data is classified into three categories:

#### Public Information
- Marketing materials
- Public documentation
- Press releases

#### Internal Information
- Internal communications
- Project plans
- Financial reports (non-sensitive)

#### Confidential Information
- Customer data
- Source code
- Trade secrets
- Financial details

### Access Control

Access to systems and data must follow the principle of least privilege.

#### User Access Management

- All users must have unique credentials
- Access rights reviewed quarterly
- Terminated employees' access revoked within 24 hours

### Compliance Requirements

ACME maintains compliance with:
- SOC 2 Type II
- GDPR for European customers
- CCPA for California customers
- ISO 27001 certification

## Product Security

### Security Features in ACME Products

Our products include enterprise-grade security:

#### ACME Analytics Security
- Role-based access control (RBAC)
- Data encryption at rest and in transit
- Audit logging of all data access
- Multi-factor authentication support

#### ACME Cloud Security
- Network isolation
- Security groups and firewalls
- DDoS protection
- Vulnerability scanning

### Security Incident Response

In case of security incidents:

1. Detect and contain the incident
2. Notify security team immediately
3. Investigate root cause
4. Implement remediation
5. Document lessons learned

### Penetration Testing

ACME conducts annual penetration testing:
- Third-party security firms
- Full scope testing of all products
- Remediation of findings within 30 days

## Employee Security Training

### Onboarding Security Training

New employees complete security training covering:
- Password policies
- Phishing awareness
- Data handling procedures
- Incident reporting

### Ongoing Training

Quarterly security awareness updates on:
- Latest threats
- Security best practices
- Compliance requirements

## Physical Security

### Office Security

ACME offices maintain physical security measures:
- Badge access required
- Visitor sign-in and escort
- Security cameras
- After-hours alarm systems

### Device Security

Company devices must:
- Use full-disk encryption
- Have screen lock enabled
- Run approved antivirus software
- Receive regular security updates

## Contact Information

For security concerns or incidents:
- Security Team: security@acme.com
- Emergency Hotline: 1-800-ACME-SEC
- Report incidents immediately

model_response.content:
I couldn't find any information about rate limits on API calls in the available ACME documentation, including engineering best practices, product documentation for ACME Cloud and ACME Analytics, or security guidelines.

This information might be available from the ACME Engineering team or the specific product teams (e.g., ACME Cloud or ACME Analytics teams) if you are looking for details on their respective APIs.
